newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: PNOC to join Fuga Island oil exploration.
newsitem.headline: PNOC to join Fuga Island oil exploration.

text.p: The Philippine National Oil Co-Exploration Corp said on Tuesday its board had agreed to take a 15 percent stake in a consortium that has a permit to drill at Fuga Island in the northern Philippines
PNOC-EC president Rufino Bomasang told Reuters on Tuesday that the 15 percent stake will cost 13.2 million pesos.
Australia-based Stirling Resources is the lead operator of the exploration contract covering Fuga Island.
"We expect to start drilling next year," Bomasang said.
He added that Fuga is estimated to contain recoverable reserves ranging from 5.0 to 18 trillion cubic feet of natural gas.
Fuga is being developed into a resort and industrial free port zone by Philippine property tycoon Tan Yu and Taiwan's Tuntex Group.
